title: Adverb Collection 1
sentences: The news spread like wildfire in the city.
The results turned out relatively good compared to expectations.
The defendant immediately confessed his guilt.
The new method is fundamentally different from the previous ones.
The symptoms of the disease appeared sporadically among the population.
During the experiment, we examined everything thoroughly.
The situation has improved somewhat in recent days.
The perpetrator has presumably left the country.
The rain fell continuously, so we postponed the trip.
If you need help, look me up sometime/on occasion!
The supplies will eventually run out if we don't get reinforcements.
He lost his job, consequently/therefore he has no income.
The task was entrusted to him entirely.
Speak more clearly because I can't hear you!
The decision was accepted unanimously by the committee.
He described everything point by point in the report.
The news was notoriously/well-known to be false.
I read the book from beginning to end in one day.
Unfortunately, he makes the same mistakes over and over again.
The plan had to be changed in the meantime.
The event was broadcast live on television.
We must discuss this question in detail.
The two countries mutually support each other.
dictionary:
futótűzként - like wildfire
viszonylag - relatively
nyomban - immediately / at once
merőben - fundamentally / entirely
szórványosan - sporadically
tüzetesen - thoroughly / closely
némiképp - somewhat / to some extent
vélhetően - presumably / probably
folyvást - continuously / constantly
alkalomadtán - on occasion / occasionally
hovatovább - eventually / as time goes on
ennélfogva - consequently / therefore
mindenestül - entirely / lock, stock, and barrel
érthetőbben - more clearly
egyhangúlag - unanimously
pontról pontra - point by point
köztudottan - notoriously / well-known
elejétől végéig - from beginning to end
minduntalan - over and over again / incessantly
időközben - in the meantime
élőben - live
lelkiismeretesen - conscientiously
részletesen - in detail
kézenfekvően - obviously / evidently
kölcsönösen - mutually
